greek_pasta_salad.name: Greek Tortellini Pasta Salad
greek_pasta_salad.description: A refreshing and flavorful Greek pasta salad tossed in a zesty lemon-herb dressing.
instructions: In a small bowl or jar, combine all dressing ingredients: olive oil, apple cider vinegar, garlic, oregano, basil, thyme, sugar, Dijon mustard, and lemon juice. Mix or shake well until emulsified.
Cook tortellini to al dente according to package instructions. Rinse with cold water and set aside to cool.
Finely chop the red onion, artichoke hearts, and basil. Peel cucumber, slice into rounds, then quarter the slices.
In a large bowl, combine cooled tortellini, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, artichokes, and feta.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss until well coated.
Refrigerate for 3-6 hours for best flavor. Toss again before serving.

buffalo_spaghetti_squash.name: Buffalo Chicken Spaghetti Squash
buffalo_spaghetti_squash.description: A delicious way to enjoy vegetables that tastes just like buffalo wings—without the guilt.
ingredients: 4 oz low fat shredded cheddar cheese
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Slice spaghetti squash in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds, and roast cut-side down on a baking sheet for 35-45 minutes until tender.
While the squash is roasting, season chicken with salt and pepper. Cook on stovetop or bake until fully cooked, then shred.
In a large bowl, mix shredded chicken with hot sauce and ranch.
Once squash is done, use a fork to shred into noodles. Add to bowl with the buffalo chicken mixture and toss gently.
Fold in shredded cabbage and scallions. Transfer to a baking dish or back into squash skins if preferred.
Top with cheddar cheese and return to the oven for 10-15 minutes, until cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve warm and enjoy!

buffalo_chicken_dip.name: Buffalo Chicken Dip
buffalo_chicken_dip.description: A staple party snack and an amazing side dish with a spicy, creamy kick.
instructions: Lightly season chicken with salt and pepper.
Cook chicken on the stovetop until done, then shred.
In a saucepan over medium heat, combine all ingredients and stir constantly.
Once the cheese is melted and everything is heated through (about 10-15 minutes), serve warm and enjoy!

fish_tacos.name: Spicy Fish Tacos
fish_tacos.description: A simple and satisfying fish taco dinner with a light, zesty slaw.
instructions: Pat the fish dry and season both sides with salt and pepper.
In a bowl, mix the zest of half a lime with cornstarch, paprika, chili powder, harissa, and cayenne.
Evenly coat the fish with the spice mixture, rubbing it in gently.
Heat neutral oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the fish for 3-4 minutes per side, until golden and crispy.
Set the fish aside on a paper towel to cool. Once cooled, shred into bite-sized pieces.
In a bowl, mix cabbage, cilantro, green onion, juice from 1-2 limes (about 2 tablespoons), olive oil, salt, and pepper to taste.
Assemble tacos using the tortillas, fish, and slaw. Serve immediately.

egg_avocado_toast.name: Over-Easy Egg and Avocado Toast
egg_avocado_toast.description: Easy and quick early morning breakfast with healthy fats and protein.
instructions: Mash avocado and mix in cayenne, bagel seasoning, salt, and pepper.
In a pan over medium heat, melt half the butter and toast the bread to your preferred crispiness.
Spread the seasoned avocado mash on the toast and set aside.
Add the remaining butter to the pan and cook the egg to your desired doneness (over medium with a runny yolk is recommended).
Place the egg on top of the toast and serve immediately.

balsamic_brussels.name: Balsamic Brussels Sprouts
balsamic_brussels.description: An easy, fast side dish that tastes like you put a ton of effort into it.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Halve all Brussels sprouts and place on a large baking pan (all sprouts should touch the bottom of the pan).
Massage in olive oil, ensuring all sprouts have a light, even coat. Then season with salt and pepper.
Place in oven and roast for 30-45 minutes until lightly charred and crispy.
While roasting, reduce balsamic vinegar over medium-low heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens into a glaze.
(Optional) Cook bacon at 375°F for 40-45 minutes until crispy. Pat dry, then chop finely.
Toss roasted Brussels with balsamic glaze (and bacon if using), then serve and enjoy!

greek_yogurt_parfait.name: Greek Yogurt Parfait
greek_yogurt_parfait.description: A quick and refreshing breakfast or snack with layers of creamy yogurt, crunchy granola, and fresh fruit.
instructions: Prepare fruit by washing and slicing strawberries. Rinse blueberries if needed.
In each serving glass or bowl, spoon 1/4 cup of Greek yogurt into the bottom.
Add a layer of granola (about 2 tablespoons), followed by a layer of mixed fruit.
Repeat layers until the ingredients are used up, ending with fruit on top.
Drizzle honey over the top if desired, and garnish with a mint leaf.
Serve immediately for maximum crunch, or refrigerate for up to 2 hours for a softer texture.

stir_fry_noodles.name: Vegetable Stir Fry with Noodles
stir_fry_noodles.description: A quick and colorful noodle stir fry packed with crisp veggies and a savory-sweet sauce.
ingredients: 8 oz rice noodles or lo mein noodles
instructions: Cook noodles according to package instructions. Drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, hoisin, maple syrup, rice vinegar, and chili flakes. Set aside.
Heat sesame oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and ginger, sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add all vegetables except green onions. Stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until just tender but still crisp.
Add noodles and sauce to the pan. Toss everything together to combine.
If you prefer a thicker sauce, add the cornstarch by making a slurry (starch + 2 tablespoons water) and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Top with sliced green onions and serve hot.

chickpea_salad.name: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
chickpea_salad.description: A vibrant and protein-rich salad with fresh vegetables, chickpeas, and a zesty lemon-olive oil dressing.
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, olives, feta, and parsley.
In a small bowl or jar, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Alternativly you can use a bottled dressign of your choice for time and cost reduction.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently to coat all ingredients evenly.
Let sit for 10-15 minutes before serving to allow flavors to blend. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

cajun_salmon.name: Cajun Salmon Fillets
cajun_salmon.description: Flavor-packed and perfectly seasoned salmon fillets with a smoky, spicy Cajun kick.
instructions: Preheat a skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Rub salmon fillets with olive oil on both sides.
In a small bowl, mix Cajun seasoning, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Sprinkle the seasoning mixture evenly over both sides of the salmon fillets.
Place salmon fillets in the hot skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, until the salmon is cooked through and has a crispy, golden crust.
Optional: Squeeze fresh lemon juice over the fillets before serving for added brightness.
Recommened side of oven roasted asparapus: oven 375 fahrenheit, oil, salt, and pepper, cook for 30 minutes,

chocolate_mug_cake.name: Chocolate Mug Cake
chocolate_mug_cake.description: A quick and easy single-serve chocolate cake made in the microwave for those chocolate cravings.
instructions: In a microwave-safe mug, whisk together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt.
Add milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract, and stir until smooth and well combined.
Stir in chocolate chips if desired.
Microwave on high for 1 minute and 20 seconds, or until the cake has risen and is set in the middle.
Let cool for a few minutes before serving. Enjoy straight from the mug!

chocolate_truffles.name: Chocolate Truffles
chocolate_truffles.description: Rich, creamy, and indulgent vegan chocolate truffles made with coconut milk and rolled in cocoa powder or chopped nuts.
ingredients: Cocoa powder or chopped nuts for rolling (optional)
instructions: Place dark chocolate chips in a heatproof bowl.
In a small saucepan, heat coconut milk over medium heat until it begins to simmer (but not boil).
Pour hot coconut milk over the chocolate chips and let sit for 2-3 minutes.
Stir until the chocolate is fully melted and smooth. Add vanilla extract and a pinch of salt, and mix to combine.
Refrigerate the chocolate mixture for about 15 minutes to firm up.
Once firm, scoop out small portions and roll them into balls using your hands.
Roll the truffles in cocoa powder or chopped nuts for coating.
Refrigerate the truffles for another 10-15 minutes before serving.

chicken_noodle_soup.name: Chicken Noodle Soup
chicken_noodle_soup.description: A light and comforting chicken noodle soup packed with lean protein and fresh vegetables.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add diced onion, garlic, carrots, and celery. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are softened.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil.
Add shredded chicken, noodles, thyme, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10-12 minutes, or until noodles are tender.
Stir in lemon juice and chopped parsley.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed, then serve warm.

sweet_potato_waffle.name: Savory Sweet Potato Waffles
sweet_potato_waffle.description: Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside—these savory sweet potato waffles are perfect for a unique brunch or light dinner.
ingredients: Olive oil spray or butter for waffle iron
instructions: Preheat your waffle iron according to the manufacturer's instructions and lightly grease.
In a bowl, whisk together mashed sweet potato, eggs, milk, and cheese until smooth.
Add flour, baking powder, garlic powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Mix until just combined.
Scoop batter into the center of the waffle iron (amount will depend on size of your iron) and close the lid.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, or until waffles are golden and crisp on the edges.
Carefully remove and serve immediately with a dollop of Greek yogurt, avocado, or sautéed greens.

strawberry_banana_smoothie.name: Strawberry Banana Smoothie
strawberry_banana_smoothie.description: A creamy, naturally sweet smoothie perfect for breakfast or a quick snack.
ingredients: 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender, add less ice then you think you can always add more later.
Blend on high until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust sweetness or thickness if desired.
Pour into a glass and serve.

beef_stew.name: Beef Stew
beef_stew.description: A rich, slow-simmered stew packed with tender beef and low-carb veggies—perfect for a comforting keto meal.
ingredients: 1 cup turnips or radishes (peeled and chopped)
1 tablespoon coconut flour (optional, for slight thickening)
instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium-high heat.
Sear beef cubes on all sides until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté onion, garlic, celery, and mushrooms until softened (5-7 minutes).
Add tomato paste, thyme, rosemary, salt, pepper, and stir well.
Return beef to the pot. Add turnips/radishes, bay leaf, and pour in beef broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 1.5-2 hours until beef is fork-tender.
Optional: stir in coconut flour in the last 10 minutes to slightly thicken the broth.
Remove bay leaf before serving. Enjoy warm.

egg_muffins.name: Egg Muffins
egg_muffins.description: Easy low-carb egg muffins packed with protein and veggies—perfect for on-the-go breakfasts.
ingredients: 1/4 cup heavy cream (or unsweetened almond milk)
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 6-cup muffin tin or use silicone liners.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, cream, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Fold in spinach, bell pepper, onion, cheese, and cooked bacon or sausage.
Pour the mixture evenly into muffin cups (about 3/4 full).
Bake for 18-22 minutes, or until muffins are puffed and set in the center.
Let cool slightly, then remove and enjoy. Store extras in fridge for up to 5 days.

spam_musubi.name: Spam Musubi
spam_musubi.description: A Hawaiian favorite—Spam glazed in a sweet soy sauce, pressed over rice, and wrapped in seaweed. Perfectly portable and super satisfying.
ingredients: 1 can Spam (12 oz, original or low sodium)
2 tablespoons furikake seasoning (optional, for rice seasoning)
4 full sheets of nori (seaweed), cut in half
instructions: Cook rice according to package instructions. Season with furikake seasoning and salt if desired.
Slice Spam into 8 even slices.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, sugar, and sesame oil.
In a skillet over medium heat, place spam and pour sauce mixture over.
Fry Spam slices until lightly browned on both sides.
Place a strip of nori shiny-side down. Add a layer of warm rice (using a musubi mold or your hands), pressing gently to form a compact layer.
Top with a slice of glazed Spam, then add another thin layer of rice if preferred.
Wrap nori around the stack and seal by moistening the edge with a bit of water.
Let rest seam-side down for a few minutes before slicing or serving.

salmon_rice_bake.name: Salmon Rice Bake
salmon_rice_bake.description: A comforting baked rice dish layered with flaked salmon, seasoned rice, and a spicy sriracha mayo drizzle.
ingredients: 2 cups cooked jasmine or short-grain rice
1 tablespoon furikake or sesame seeds (for garnish)
Optional: nori strips for topping or serving
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease an 8x8-inch baking dish.
In a bowl, season cooked rice with soy sauce, sesame oil, garlic powder, and green onion.
Flake cooked salmon into bite-sized pieces and gently mix into rice.
Spread the salmon rice mixture evenly in the baking dish.
In a small bowl, mix mayo, sriracha, and rice vinegar. Adjust heat level to taste.
Drizzle the sriracha mayo over the rice mixture (or spread evenly if preferred).
Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes, until warmed through and lightly golden on top.
Top with avocado slices, furikake, and nori if desired. Serve warm!

club_sandwich.name: Classic Club Sandwich
club_sandwich.description: A classic triple-decker sandwich with turkey, bacon, lettuce, tomato, and mayo on toasted bread—perfect for a filling lunch.
ingredients: 3 slices of your favorite bread (can be GF)
2-3 slices of turkey or chicken breast
instructions: Toast 3 slices of bread until golden brown and crispy.
Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy. Drain on paper towels.
Spread mayonnaise on two slices of toasted bread. Optionally, add a thin layer of mustard to one slice.
Layer the first slice of bread with turkey slices, followed by a layer of tomato, and some bacon.
Place the second slice of bread on top, then layer with lettuce, more turkey, bacon, and tomato.
Top with the third slice of bread.
Secure the sandwich with toothpicks on all four corners, then cut the sandwich into quarters or halves.

mediterranean_baked_cod.name: Mediterranean Baked Cod with Tomatoes and Olives
mediterranean_baked_cod.description: A light, flavorful fish dish baked with juicy tomatoes, briny olives, and fresh herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place cod fillets in a baking dish and season with salt and pepper.
Scatter cherry tomatoes, olives, and garlic around the fish.
Drizzle olive oil and lemon juice over the top.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

mediterranean_quinoa_bowl.name: Mediterranean Quinoa Bowl with Hummus
mediterranean_quinoa_bowl.description: A wholesome grain bowl with fresh vegetables, creamy hummus, and a lemon-olive oil drizzle.
ingredients: Optional: crumbled feta or chopped parsley
instructions: Rinse quinoa and cook with water or broth according to package directions (about 15 minutes).
Once done, fluff with a fork and divide into serving bowls.
Top each bowl with tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, avocado, and a scoop of hummus.
Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper, and garnish with parsley or feta if desired.

stuffed_peppers_quinoa.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Quinoa and Feta
stuffed_peppers_quinoa.description: Sweet bell peppers roasted and filled with a hearty blend of quinoa, chickpeas, and feta—a balanced, plant-forward main dish.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, combine quinoa, chickpeas, feta, tomatoes, parsley, olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Spoon the mixture into the halved bell peppers.
Place peppers in a baking dish and cover loosely with foil.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until the peppers are tender.
Uncover and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes to brown the tops.
Serve warm.

shakshuka.name: Shakshuka (Poached Eggs in Tomato Sauce)
shakshuka.description: A cozy North African-inspired dish with eggs simmered in a spiced tomato and bell pepper sauce. Ideal for any meal of the day.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sauté onion and bell pepper until soft.
Add garlic, paprika, cumin, and chili flakes. Cook for 1 minute.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes to thicken.
Make 4 small wells in the sauce and crack an egg into each well.
Cover the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the eggs are set to your liking.
Garnish with fresh herbs and serve with crusty bread or pita.

grilled_eggplant_yogurt.name: Grilled Eggplant with Herbed Yogurt Sauce
grilled_eggplant_yogurt.description: Smoky grilled eggplant slices served with a creamy Greek yogurt sauce—perfect as a side, starter, or light main.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons chopped fresh dill or mint
instructions: Brush eggplant slices with olive oil and season with salt.
Grill or pan-sear over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes per side, until tender and lightly charred.
In a small bowl, mix Greek yogurt, garlic, lemon juice, herbs, salt, and pepper.
Serve the grilled eggplant warm or at room temperature with a dollop of herbed yogurt sauce.

lemon_herb_chicken_farro.name: Lemon Herb Chicken with Farro Salad
lemon_herb_chicken_farro.description: Juicy, marinated chicken thighs served over a hearty farro salad with cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, and fresh herbs.
instructions: In a bowl, mix lemon juice, zest, olive oil, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper. Marinate chicken for at least 20 minutes.
Cook farro in water or broth according to package instructions (about 25 minutes). Drain and let cool.
Grill or pan-sear chicken on medium heat for 6-7 minutes per side, until fully cooked.
In a large bowl, combine farro, cucumber, tomatoes, parsley, vinegar, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Slice chicken and serve over the farro salad.

tuna_whitebean_pita.name: Tuna and White Bean Salad with Pita
tuna_whitebean_pita.description: A simple, high-protein salad featuring tuna, creamy white beans, crisp veggies, and warm pita for scooping.
ingredients: 1 (15 oz) can white beans (drained and rinsed)
instructions: In a bowl, combine tuna, white beans, onion, cucumber, capers, parsley, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Gently toss to combine, being careful not to mash the beans too much.
Warm pita in a dry skillet or toaster.
Serve the salad with pita on the side for scooping or wrapping.

lamb_kofta_yogurt.name: Lamb Kofta with Yogurt-Tahini Sauce
lamb_kofta_yogurt.description: Middle Eastern spiced lamb kofta grilled and served with a creamy yogurt-tahini sauce and cucumber salad.
instructions: In a bowl, combine lamb, garlic, onion, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, salt, and pepper.
Form into 8-10 small patties or oval-shaped kofta and chill for 10 minutes.
Grill or pan-sear over medium-high heat for about 4-5 minutes per side until browned and cooked through.
For the sauce, whisk together yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and salt until smooth.
Serve kofta with yogurt sauce and optional cucumber salad or flatbread.

garlic_shrimp_pasta.name: Garlic Shrimp Pasta with Spinach and Sun-Dried Tomatoes
garlic_shrimp_pasta.description: A light and zesty Mediterranean pasta tossed with garlicky shrimp, baby spinach, and sun-dried tomatoes in olive oil.
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water and drain the rest.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes; cook for 30 seconds.
Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes per side until pink. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add sun-dried tomatoes and spinach. Cook until spinach wilts.
Add cooked pasta, shrimp, lemon juice, and reserved pasta water as needed.
Toss everything to coat evenly and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with parsley and serve warm.

moroccan_couscous_veggies.name: Moroccan Couscous with Roasted Vegetables
moroccan_couscous_veggies.description: Warm, fluffy couscous topped with a rainbow of spiced roasted veggies, chickpeas, and a drizzle of lemon dressing.
ingredients: 1 1/4 cups boiling water or vegetable broth
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Toss chopped vegetables and chickpeas with olive oil, cumin, cinnamon, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until tender and slightly charred.
In a bowl, pour boiling water or broth over couscous. Cover and let sit for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork.
Top couscous with roasted vegetables, squeeze lemon juice on top, and sprinkle with parsley.
Serve warm or at room temperature.

bulgur_tabbouleh_chicken.name: Bulgur Tabbouleh with Grilled Chicken
bulgur_tabbouleh_chicken.description: A refreshing take on tabbouleh, served as a full meal with grilled lemon herb chicken over herby bulgur.
instructions: Place bulgur in a large bowl and cover with boiling water. Cover and let sit for 15-20 minutes, then fluff.
In a small bowl, mix lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper to dress the tabbouleh.
Add cucumber, tomatoes, onion, parsley, and mint to the bulgur. Pour dressing over and mix well.
Season chicken with oregano, garlic, salt, pepper, and olive oil.
Grill or pan-sear chicken on medium-high heat for 5-6 minutes per side, until fully cooked.
Slice chicken and serve over tabbouleh salad.

banana_oat_muffins.name: Banana Oat Muffins
banana_oat_muffins.description: Wholesome banana oat muffins with no refined sugar—great for breakfast or healthy snacking.
ingredients: 1/3 cup mini chocolate chips or chopped nuts (optional)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease or line a muffin tin.
In a bowl, mash bananas and mix with eggs, syrup, oil, vanilla, and almond milk.
Stir in oats, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt until combined.
Fold in chocolate chips or nuts if using.
Divide batter evenly into muffin cups and bake for 18-22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool before serving. Store in an airtight container.

breakfast_burrito.name: Breakfast Burrito
breakfast_burrito.description: A protein-packed breakfast burrito filled with scrambled eggs, veggies, and black beans wrapped in a whole wheat tortilla.
ingredients: 1/2 cup canned black beans (drained and rinsed)
1/3 cup shredded cheddar or Mexican blend cheese
Optional: salsa, avocado, hot sauce for serving
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add bell peppers and onion, cook until softened (3–4 min).
Add black beans and cook for another 2 minutes.
Pour in egg mixture and scramble until fully cooked.
Warm tortillas and divide the egg mixture evenly among them.
Top with cheese and optional toppings like salsa or avocado.
Fold into burritos and serve warm or wrap for later.

mediterranean_breakfast_bowl.name: Mediterranean Breakfast Bowl
mediterranean_breakfast_bowl.description: A refreshing and wholesome Mediterranean breakfast bowl with eggs, hummus, fresh veggies, and whole grains.
ingredients: Fresh parsley or dill for garnish
Optional: Kalamata olives, crumbled feta cheese, lemon wedge
instructions: Cook the quinoa or farro according to package instructions if not pre-cooked.
In a skillet, fry or poach the eggs to your desired doneness.
In each bowl, layer the grains, avocado, tomatoes, cucumber, and egg.
Add a dollop of hummus and drizzle with olive oil.
Season with salt, pepper, and garnish with herbs.
Add optional toppings like olives, feta, or a squeeze of lemon. Serve immediately.

breakfast_hash.name: Breakfast Hash
breakfast_hash.description: A hearty and healthy breakfast hash with sweet potatoes, eggs, spinach, and avocado.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add diced sweet potatoes and cook for 10 minutes or until tender.
Add bell peppers, onion, and paprika. Cook for 5-7 minutes until veggies are softened.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
In a separate pan, cook eggs to your liking (fried or scrambled).
Top hash with eggs and sliced avocado. Season with salt and pepper.

coconut_lime_shrimp.name: Coconut Lime Shrimp
coconut_lime_shrimp.description: Juicy shrimp simmered in creamy coconut milk with zesty lime and chili flakes.
instructions: Heat coconut oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and red pepper flakes; sauté for 1 minute.
Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 5-8 minutes total.
Pour in coconut milk, lime juice, and zest. Stir to coat.
Simmer for 2 more minutes until heated through.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve hot.

turkey_avocado_wrap.name: Turkey Avocado Lettuce Wraps
turkey_avocado_wrap.description: A low-carb, high-protein lunch made with lean turkey, creamy avocado, and fresh veggies wrapped in crisp lettuce leaves.
ingredients: 6 large romaine or butter lettuce leaves
instructions: Lay the lettuce leaves flat and pat dry if needed.
Spread a small amount of mustard on each leaf.
Layer turkey, avocado, tomato, and onion on top.
Season with salt and pepper.
Roll or fold into wraps and serve immediately.

grilled_chicken_hummus_bowl.name: Grilled Chicken & Hummus Bowl
grilled_chicken_hummus_bowl.description: A balanced Mediterranean-style bowl featuring juicy grilled chicken, creamy hummus, and fresh veggies over greens or grains.
ingredients: 1 cup cooked quinoa or brown rice
instructions: Divide greens into two bowls.
Top with chicken, quinoa or rice, veggies, olives, and feta.
Add a scoop of hummus to each bowl.
Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper and serve.

zucchini_pesto_noodles.name: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto & Cherry Tomatoes
zucchini_pesto_noodles.description: A light and refreshing low-carb dish featuring spiralized zucchini tossed with pesto and juicy cherry tomatoes.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add zucchini noodles and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Stir in pesto and cherry tomatoes. Cook 1-2 more minutes.
Add grilled protein if using, and toss everything together.
Season with salt and pepper and serve warm or cold.

chia_pudding.name: Vanilla Chia Pudding
chia_pudding.description: A creamy and nutrient-rich snack packed with fiber, omega-3s, and natural sweetness.
ingredients: Optional toppings: berries, granola, coconut flakes
instructions: In a bowl or jar, mix chia seeds, almond milk, vanilla, and sweetener.
Stir well, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight.
Stir again before serving and add toppings as desired.

apple_peanut_bites.name: Apple Peanut Butter Bites
apple_peanut_bites.description: Crisp apple slices paired with creamy peanut butter and toppings for a satisfying and energizing snack.
ingredients: Optional: drizzle of honey or sprinkle of cinnamon
instructions: Spread peanut butter over apple slices.
Sprinkle with granola, nuts, or cinnamon.
Serve immediately as a quick snack.

roasted_chickpeas.name: Crispy Roasted Chickpeas
roasted_chickpeas.description: A crunchy, high-protein snack that's perfect for munching and easy to season your way.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat chickpeas dry and toss with oil and seasonings.
Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 30-35 minutes until crispy.
Cool before serving or storing.

edamame.name: Edamame
edamame.description: A simple and satisfying snack, edamame beans are packed with protein and served with a pinch of sea salt.
ingredients: 2 cups edamame (in pods, frozen or fresh)
instructions: Boil or steam edamame pods for 3-5 minutes until tender.
Drain and sprinkle with sea salt and chili flakes (or sesame seeds if desired).
Serve warm or chilled.

rice_paper_rolls.name: Fresh Rice Paper Rolls
rice_paper_rolls.description: These fresh, crunchy rice paper rolls are filled with vegetables and shrimp, served with a tangy dipping sauce.
instructions: Soak rice paper wrappers in warm water until soft.
Place shrimp, cucumber, carrots, cilantro, and lettuce in the center of the wrapper.
Roll tightly, folding in the sides as you go.
For the dipping sauce, mix rice vinegar, soy sauce, honey, and chili sauce (optional).
Serve rolls with dipping sauce.

veggie_chips_with_guacamole.name: Veggie Chips with Guacamole
veggie_chips_with_guacamole.description: A creamy, flavorful guacamole served with crispy, homemade veggie chips for a healthy, satisfying snack.
ingredients: 2 cups assorted vegetable chips (or homemade baked tortilla chips)
instructions: In a bowl, mash the avocados.
Add onion, tomato, garlic, lime juice, and cilantro.
Season with salt and pepper, then stir to combine.
Serve guacamole with veggie chips or homemade tortilla chips.

mini_quesadillas.name: Mini Quesadillas
mini_quesadillas.description: Quick and easy mini quesadillas made with whole wheat tortillas, cheese, and a sprinkle of spices.
ingredients: 1/2 cup shredded cheese (cheddar, mozzarella, or Mexican blend)
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium heat and lightly grease with olive oil.
Place a tortilla in the skillet, sprinkle with cheese, and top with another tortilla.
Cook until golden and crispy, flipping halfway through.
Cut into wedges and serve with salsa or guacamole.

mexican_street_corn_bites.name: Mexican Street Corn Bites
mexican_street_corn_bites.description: Mini corn bites inspired by Mexican street corn, topped with cheese, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime.
ingredients: 4 mini corn cobs (or 2 medium-sized corn on the cob)
instructions: Grill or boil the corn until tender, about 7-12 minutes.
Cut the corn into bite-sized pieces.
Sprinkle the corn with cotija cheese, cilantro, chili powder, paprika, and salt.
Serve with lime wedges.

lemon_herb_couscous.name: Lemon-Herb Couscous with Olives and Tomatoes
lemon_herb_couscous.description: A bright, fluffy couscous dish with cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives, and fresh herbs.
ingredients: 1 cup boiling water or vegetable broth
instructions: Place couscous in a bowl, pour boiling broth over it, cover and let sit for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork and stir in olive oil, lemon juice, tomatoes, olives, and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature.

garlic_roasted_broccoli.name: Garlic Roasted Broccoli with Lemon Zest
garlic_roasted_broccoli.description: Crispy oven-roasted broccoli tossed in olive oil, garlic, and fresh lemon zest.
ingredients: 1 large head of broccoli (cut into florets)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Toss broccoli with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet.
Roast for 18-22 minutes until crisp and golden.
Sprinkle with lemon zest before serving.

caprese_skewers.name: Caprese Skewers with Basil Balsamic Drizzle
caprese_skewers.description: Fresh mozzarella, basil, and tomatoes on skewers, finished with balsamic reduction.
instructions: Alternate tomato, basil, and mozzarella on each skewer.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and season with salt and pepper.
Serve chilled or room temp.

zucchini_fries.name: Zucchini Fries with Garlic Aioli
zucchini_fries.description: Baked zucchini fries with a crispy almond flour coating and a creamy garlic aioli dip.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment.
Dip zucchini sticks in egg, then coat with almond flour mixture.
Bake 20-25 minutes until golden and crisp.
Mix mayo, garlic, and lemon for aioli. Serve with fries.

cauliflower_mash.name: Cauliflower Mash with Olive Oil and Garlic
cauliflower_mash.description: A creamy and savory mashed cauliflower dish perfect as a low-carb paleo alternative to mashed potatoes.
instructions: Steam cauliflower until tender (10-12 minutes).
In a skillet, lightly sauté garlic in olive oil.
Blend cauliflower, garlic, oil, salt, and pepper until smooth.
Garnish with chopped chives and serve warm.

cucumber_dill_salad.name: Cucumber Dill Salad with Red Onion
cucumber_dill_salad.description: A crisp, refreshing salad with sliced cucumber, red onion, and a Whole30-friendly vinegar dressing.
instructions: Toss cucumber and onion in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, whisk vinegar, olive oil, dill, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad, toss, and let chill 10 minutes before serving.

roasted_red_pepper_hummus.name: Roasted Red Pepper Hummus
roasted_red_pepper_hummus.description: Creamy, smoky hummus made with roasted red peppers and tahini. Perfect as a dip or side spread.
ingredients: 1 roasted red bell pepper (jarred or homemade)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a food processor and blend until smooth.
Adjust seasoning as needed. Add water to thin if necessary.
Serve chilled or room temp with pita or veggies.

charred_asparagus_lemon.name: Charred Asparagus with Lemon Zest
charred_asparagus_lemon.description: Tender asparagus charred in a skillet and finished with lemon zest and olive oil.
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add asparagus and cook 5-7 minutes, flipping occasionally until slightly charred.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon zest. Serve warm.

avocado_tomato_salad.name: Avocado Tomato Salad
avocado_tomato_salad.description: A quick salad with creamy avocado, juicy tomatoes, and a light olive oil dressing.
instructions: Combine avocado and tomatoes in a bowl.
Drizzle with olive oil and vinegar.
Toss gently and season with salt and pepper.

parmesan_cauliflower_bites.name: Crispy Parmesan Cauliflower Bites
parmesan_cauliflower_bites.description: Roasted cauliflower coated in herbs and parmesan for a low-carb, keto-friendly crunch.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Toss cauliflower with oil and seasonings, then coat with parmesan.
Roast on a baking sheet for 20-25 minutes, flipping once.
Serve hot as a crispy side.

roasted_beets_carrots.name: Roasted Beets and Carrots
roasted_beets_carrots.description: Earthy beets and sweet carrots roasted to bring out their natural flavors.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.
Toss beets and carrots with olive oil, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Roast for 30-40 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
Serve warm.

garlic_green_beans.name: Sautéed Garlic Green Beans
garlic_green_beans.description: Simple green beans sautéed in olive oil and garlic — a fast Whole30-friendly side dish.
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add green beans and sauté for 5-8 minutes until tender-crisp.
Season and serve.

mediterranean_orzo_salad.name: Mediterranean Orzo Salad
mediterranean_orzo_salad.description: A light and flavorful pasta salad with orzo, tomatoes, feta, and olives in a lemon vinaigrette.
instructions: Cook orzo according to package instructions. Drain and let cool.
Combine orzo, tomatoes, olives, feta, and parsley in a bowl.
Whisk together olive oil, vinegar, lemon zest, salt, and pepper. Pour over salad and toss.
Chill for 15 minutes before serving.

bulgur_herb_pilaf.name: Bulgur Wheat Pilaf with Herbs
bulgur_herb_pilaf.description: A warm, nutty bulgur side dish tossed with fresh herbs and olive oil.
instructions: In a saucepan, bring broth to a boil. Stir in bulgur, cover, and remove from heat. Let sit for 15 minutes.
Fluff bulgur with a fork, stir in olive oil, garlic, parsley, salt, and pepper.
Serve warm or room temperature.

whole_wheat_panzanella.name: Whole Wheat Panzanella
whole_wheat_panzanella.description: A rustic Italian bread salad made with toasted whole wheat bread, tomatoes, and cucumbers.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. Toast bread cubes for 10-12 minutes until crisp.
Combine bread, tomatoes, cucumber, and onion in a bowl.
Whisk oil, vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper. Pour over salad and toss well.
Let sit for 10-15 minutes to soak up flavor, then serve.

creamy_macaroni_side_bake.name: Creamy Macaroni Side Bake
creamy_macaroni_side_bake.description: A comforting, cheesy baked macaroni casserole served as a hearty side dish.
instructions: Cook macaroni to al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a saucepan, melt butter and whisk in flour. Cook 1 minute.
Slowly whisk in milk and cook until thickened.
Stir in cheese, paprika, salt, and pepper until melted.
Combine with pasta, pour into a baking dish, and bake at 375°F for 15-20 min until bubbly.

garlic_herb_bread.name: Garlic Bread with Olive Oil and Herbs
garlic_herb_bread.description: Crispy slices of bread toasted with olive oil, garlic, and herbs — a savory, simple side.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F.
Mix olive oil, garlic, oregano, basil, and salt.
Brush on bread slices and toast for 8-10 minutes until golden.
Serve warm.

couscous_pine_nuts.name: Couscous with Toasted Pine Nuts
couscous_pine_nuts.description: Light and fluffy couscous side dish tossed with olive oil and toasted pine nuts.
instructions: Toast pine nuts in a dry skillet until golden and fragrant.
Bring water or broth to a boil, stir in couscous, cover and remove from heat. Let sit for 5 minutes.
Fluff with a fork, add olive oil, pine nuts, and parsley. Season and serve.

fried_rice_scallions.name: Fried Rice with Soy Sauce and Scallions
fried_rice_scallions.description: Simple and satisfying fried rice tossed with scallions and savory soy sauce.
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a skillet over medium heat.
Add rice and stir-fry 3-5 minutes. Push rice to the side, scramble egg if using, then combine.
Stir in soy sauce and green onions. Season and serve.

cheesy_polenta.name: Cheesy Polenta with Butter
cheesy_polenta.description: Creamy cooked polenta stirred with butter and cheese — a rich and comforting side dish.
instructions: Bring liquid to a boil. Slowly whisk in polenta, reduce heat to low.
Cook, stirring frequently, until thick and creamy (15-20 minutes).
Stir in butter and cheese. Season and serve warm.
